Description: A male criminal *theft / mugging* a bicycle parked in front of a mosque. Four hours later, vigilantes acting on a tip-off apprehended *arrest* *arrest* *arrest* the criminal inside the market and recovered the bicycle, before handing him over to GF/NPF.

OAG operatives with rifles freed two civilians at the outskirts of this area. They had earlier been  Kidnap/Abduction during a VCP along Maiduguri-Damaturu road. Reportedly, the operatives gave each of them 30,000 Naira.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an *IVCP* along the road. They stopped several commercial vehicles in transit and robbed the passengers of money and other valuables. The operatives carjacked two commercial vehicles conveying foodstuff and Kidnap/Kidnap/Abductionion the drivers. Shortly after, they freed the vehicles along with the drivers after the vehicles showed signs of mechanical failure.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an *IVCP* along this road. They stopped four commercial vehicles in transit and Kidnap/Kidnap/Abductionion the occupants of two of the vehicles (16 male passengers and two drivers) and took the vehicles. Thereafter, they asked all the passengers of the other two commercial vehicles to disembark and subsequently carjacked the vehicles and Kidnap/Kidnap/Abductionion the drivers only. They took the four vehicles and the Kidnap/Abductionees into the bush. Thereafter, the operatives robbed the 16 passengers and two drivers of money and valuables before releasing them and left two vehicles, while keeping two other vehicles. Two other drivers remained captive.
A male criminal attempted to burgle a residence. Nearby civilians sighted, apprehended *arrest* *arrest* and handed him over to GF/NPF.
Criminals *burlary* a residence and *theft / mugging* mobile phones.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an *IVCP* along the road. They stopped several commercial vehicles in transit, asked for passengers’ identification and subsequently Kidnap/Kidnap/Abductionion nine civilians including an IO staff. The operatives allowed the remaining passengers to continue their journey.

Commercial tricycle riders staged a demonstration against transport officials and blocked a section of the road. GF/NPF deployed to the area and dispersed the crowd. One male child sustained injuries during the demonstration.
OAG operatives with rifles freed one of the four drivers that had been  Kidnap/Abduction with their vehicles during a VCP at Aljari on 01.01.2020.
OAG operatives with rifles on foot came across a group of civilians fetching firewood,  Kidnap/Abduction one male civilian while others managed to escape.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an *IVCP* along this road. They stopped several commercial vehicles in transit and robbed the passengers of money and other valuables. The operatives left the area upon sighting GF/NA vehicles  on patrol along the road.
Criminals *theft / mugging* a motorized tricycle parked along a street.

GF/NA members together with GF/CJTF members on patrol encountered OAG operatives in their camp and exchanged fire with them forcing the operatives to vacate it. During the clash, GF killed five operatives and recovered two bicycles and foodstuff. Additionally, they set on fire the OAG structures in the area.
GF/NA fired several heavy *artillery engagement* projectiles and HMGs towards Alimiri area upon sighting suspected OAG movements.
‘Kalare’ gang members armed with machetes **knife attack* attack* and sticks damaged two civilian vehicles parked along a street for unknown reasons.

Two male criminals *theft / mugging* two bicycles parked in the area. Male civilians apprehended *arrest* *arrest* them, handed them over to GF/NPF and recovered the *theft / mugging*n bicycles on 04.01.2021.
Criminals armed with handguns entered a farm, injured two male civilians and rustled cattle.
Suspected OAG operatives entered a farm and *theft / mugging* crops.
GF/NAF conducted airstrikes against a suspected OAG camp. They killed at least two operatives and destroyed OAG buildings.
GF/NAF conducted airstrikes against a suspected OAG camp. They killed at least two operatives and destroyed OAG buildings.
Criminals armed with machetes **knife attack* attack* and sticks infiltrated this area and robbed occupants of foodstuff and valuables. They also injured a shop owner who resisted.
Criminals entered IDP shelters and *theft / mugging* jewelries and other valuables.
Four criminals armed with sticks, knives and machetes **knife attack* attack* attempted to rob two male civilians in a hotel. The criminals injured one civilian after he resisted.

Four criminals armed with sticks, knives and machetes **knife attack* attack* *burglary* into a residence and robbed the male occupant of money and valuables, and injured him as he resisted  resistance.
Criminals *burlary* a residence and *theft / mugging* a mobile phone and money while the occupants were asleep.
Criminals *burlary* a residence and *theft / mugging* mobile phones.
OAG operatives with rifles set up an *IVCP* along this road. They stopped several commercial vehicles in transit and robbed the passengers of money and other valuables.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an *IVCP* along this road. They stopped several commercial vehicles in transit and robbed the passengers of money and other valuables. Subsequently, the operatives carjacked three vehicles and Kidnap/Kidnap/Abductionion the drivers and two female passengers.
GF/NAF conducted airstrikes against suspected OAG structures. Casualties are unknown.
OAG operatives with rifles on motorcycles entered residences, robbed civilians of foodstuff, money and valuables. The operatives *cattle rustling* before they left the area.
OAG operatives with rifles on motorcycles entered the area and *cattle rustling*.
OAG operatives with rifles shot sporadically at civilians fetching firewood in the area which prompted them to flee. No casualties or Kidnap/Abductionions reported.

OAG operatives with rifles aboard vehicles entered this area and set on fire residences and three civilian vehicles and subsequently *looting* foodstuff and valuables. Shortly after, GF/NA reinforcement deployed and exchanged fire with them for several minutes until the GF retreated. During the armed clash, the operatives reportedly killed four GF members. One female civilian died after her residence was set on fire by the operatives while she was still inside.

A male criminal *burlary* a residence and *theft / mugging* a bicycle while the occupants were asleep. As he was leaving, nearby vigilantes sighted and apprehended *arrest* *arrest* him, and recovered the bicycle. The criminal was handed over to GF/NPF.
Three OAG operatives' family members (two women and a boy) approached a GF/CJTF position and surrendered. They arrived from Bala Ibrahim area of the Sambisa forest.
GF/NA on patrol recovered an OAG road-planted IED and safely disposed of it via controlled detonation.
A male criminal *burlary* a residence and *theft / mugging* valuables.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an *IVCP* along the road. They stopped several commercial vehicles in transit, asked for passengers’ identification and subsequently allowed the passengers to continue the journey.

GF/NA on patrol along a secondary road recovered an  ISWAP  road-planted IED and safely disposed of it via controlled detonation. On 05.01.2021 ISWAP freed a claim via Amaq indicating that the IED had exploded killing nine GF members.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an *IVCP* along this road. They stopped several commercial vehicles in transit and robbed the passengers of money and other valuables. Subsequently, the operatives carjacked a vehicle conveying foodstuff.
Two male civilians apprehended *arrest* *arrest* two criminals and handed them over to GF/NPF. The civilians had sighted and identified their bicycles that were *theft / mugging*n on 02.01.2021.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an *IVCP* along this road. They stopped several commercial vehicles in transit and robbed the passengers of money and other valuables. Subsequently, they stopped a commercial vehicle and took all the luggage of the passengers before allowing them to continue their journey.
Two ‘Shilla’ gang members armed with knives robbed two female civilians of money and valuables while walking along a street.
Suspected OAG operatives with rifles entered the residence of a GF/CJTF member and attempted to rob him, the CJTF member resisted prompting the operatives to shoot and injure him.
Criminals armed with handguns  Kidnap/Abductionion   one male civilian from his residence.
Criminals *burlary* a residence and *theft / mugging* mobile phones, a laptop and other valuables.

OAG operatives with rifles and RPGs aboard three vehicles mounted with HMGs attempted to cross over the security trench with their vehicles which wasn’t possible, prompting the operatives to enter the area on foot and fired RPGs at the GF/NA position. The RPGs fell far away from the GF position without any casualties. GF returned fire until reinforcement from the barracks arrived and exchanged fire with the operatives until they retreated. GF stationed at Charlie 6 (along Monguno-Maiduguri road axis) also fired HMGs as a show of force towards the area. Five IDPs (two male and three children) IVO of Kuya IDP camp sustained injuries from stray bullets during the cross fire while two IDPs (one male and one female) were killed by stray bullets.
Criminals rustled cattle from a farm.
Criminals *burlary* a residence and *theft / mugging* mobile phones.

GF/CJTF together with vigilantes during an operation encountered OAG operatives in the village. Two operatives surrendered to the GF while the rest fled. Additionally, GF recovered 16 civilians (four adult females, seven male and five female children) in the village and took them to Pulka town. GF recovered two locally made guns and livestock from the operatives.

OAG operatives with rifles and using one IED *ambush* a GF/NA vehicle conducting a road clearance operation. The operatives detonated a command-pull IED against the GF vehicle and opened fire at GF members. The explosion injured two GF members, while the operatives shot and killed another one.
A herdsman armed with a machete injured one male farmer on his farm on the outskirts of the town.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an *IVCP* along this road. They stopped two commercial vehicles in transit and asked all passengers to disembark and robbed them of money and valuables. Subsequently they carjacked the vehicles and Kidnap/Kidnap/Abductionion their drivers.

OAG operatives with rifles and machetes **knife attack* attack* on eight motorcycles entered residences and robbed civilians of money and valuables. The operatives injured a male civilian with machetes **knife attack* attack* for unknown reasons. Reportedly the operatives remained in the town until about 0300hrs of 06.01.2021.
A herdsman armed with a machete encroached on a farmland with cattle, damaged crops and injured a female farmer.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an *IVCP* along this road. They stopped several commercial vehicles in transit and robbed the passengers of money and other valuables before subsequently allowing them to continue their journey.

An OAG operative approached a GF/CJTF position within this town and surrendered. CJTF handed him over to GF/NA. Upon interrogation, he claimed to have come from Tumbun Gini in Abadam LGA and went to Maiduguri to visit his relative before surrendering at Monguno.

GF/NPF together with vigilantes acting on a tip-off made contact with Kidnap and Kidnap/Abduction at their hideout, leading to an exchange of fire. GF/NPF killed one male criminal, arrested three others and seized weapons.

OAG operatives with rifles on two vehicles opened fire at a GF/NPF convoy in transit along this road. GF returned fire and the exchange of fire lasted for several minutes until the operatives retreated. No casualties were reported.
OAG operatives with rifles aboard vehicles entered this area, set on fire residences, a church, and vehicles. Subsequently, they *looting* foodstuff and valuables. No casualties were reported.

OAG operatives with rifles approached the outskirts of this area and fired shots in the air prompting nearby vigilantes to return fire. Shortly after, a GF/NA reinforcement arrived from Lassa town and engaged the operatives until they retreated. No casualties were reported.

Three male criminals armed with knives attempted to rob a male civilian of his motorcycle along a secondary road. The civilian resisted prompting the criminals to injure him, while the victim managed to injure one of the criminals. The criminals fled upon sighting oncoming vehicles.
A male civilian escaped from Kidnap/Abduction him on 04.01.2021 in Pindiga.

A male criminal *theft / mugging* a sheep from a residence while the occupants were away. Four hours later, vigilantes acting on a tip-off apprehended *arrest* *arrest* *arrest* the male criminal along with a male butcher who bought the *theft / mugging*n sheep from him.  They were later handed over to GF/NPF.
GF/NA reopened a local market that was previously closed on 29.12.2020.

OAG operatives on motorcycles with rifles set up an *IVCP* along this road. The operatives shot at several commercial vehicles after the drivers refused to stop at the VCP, killing two passengers and injuring another.
GF/NA restricted movements in and out of the town. The restriction was linked to reports of heightened OAG presence.

GF/NA together with GF/CJTF on patrol made contact with OAG operatives on the outskirts of the town and exchanged fire with them until the operatives retreated. GF recovered 16 cows abandoned by the operatives.
OAG operatives with rifles opened fire at commercial vehicles in transit and injured one male civilian. The vehicles managed to continue their journey.

OAG operatives with rifles aboard vehicles approached a GF/NA checkpoint on the outskirts of the town and fired shots prompting GF to return fire and deploy re-enforcement team. The exchange of fire lasted for several minutes until the operatives withdrew. GF killed at least two operatives and seized one OAG vehicle. One male civilian sustained injuries during the cross fire.

OAG operatives with rifles aboard motorcycles opened fire at GF/NA members who were patrolling at the outskirts of the area prompting GF to return fire. They exchanged fire briefly before another group of operatives aboard vehicles arrived, which caused the GF to retreat. Subsequently, GF reinforcement team from Gajiram deployed and managed to repel the attack. During the clash, the operatives injured two GF members.

ISWAP  operatives with rifles aboard vehicles attacked a GF/NA position on the outskirts of the town, prompting GF to return fire until the operatives retreated towards the town. During the armed clash, GF killed two operatives. While in the town, the operatives set on fire two houses, vehicles and some shops. The operatives *burlary* shops, a bank and a pharmacy and *theft / mugging* foodstuff, money, drugs and other valuables. About two hours later, the operatives returned to the GF/NA position at the outskirt of the town and exchanged fire with GF until the operatives retreated again towards the town. One male civilian and a girl child sustained injury from stray bullets. The operatives remained in the town until 0300hrs on 07.01.2021. ISWAP claimed the attack via Amaq on 07.01.2021.
GF/NA *ambush* OAG operatives that were crossing a road in the area and exchanged fire with them. GF killed seven operatives and recovered bicycles, carts, and foodstuff.

GF/NA during an operation encountered  ISWAP  operatives and exchanged fire with them until the operatives withdrew. GF killed at least 12 operatives and seized weapons and ammunition. GF recovered one VBIED vehicle and destroyed another. ISWAP claimed to have repelled the attack via Amaq on 07.01.2021.
GF/NAF conducted airstrikes against a suspected OAG camp. They killed at least two operatives and destroyed OAG buildings.

OAG operatives with rifles entered a residence, shot and killed three male civilians for unknown reasons and *theft / mugging* foodstuff and livestock. While leaving, vigilantes sighted and exchanged fire with them. One vigilante member was killed during the armed clash.
Criminals *burlary* a residence, *burglary* the window of a car parked within the premises and *theft / mugging* the car battery.
OAG operatives with rifles aboard a vehicle entered this area, gathered fishermen and farmers and preached to them. Two male teenagers willingly left with the operatives.
GF/NA during an operation recovered an OAG road-planted IED and safely disposed of it via controlled detonation.

Herdsmen armed with handguns, machetes **knife attack* attack*, sticks, bows and arrows attacked civilians and farmers in the village. GF/NPF from Gashua town deployed and exchanged fire with them until the herdsmen retreated.  The herdsmen shot and injured one GF member and 12 civilians during the armed clash.

OAG operatives with rifles shot sporadically at civilians fetching firewood in this area, which prompted them to flee. The operatives set on fire one civilian vehicle before they withdrew. No casualties reported.

OAG operatives with rifles approached a GF/NA position in the location, prompting GF/NA and GF/CJTF members to open fire at them. The armed clash lasted for a few minutes until the operatives withdrew. During the armed clash, the operatives shot and injured two GF/NA members while GF shot and killed two operatives, recovered two rifles and one locally made gun.

A male civilian armed with a *knife attack* stabbed and killed another male civilian following a disagreement at a party. Relatives of the victim who were present at the scene immediately retaliated and injured at least 15 civilians with cutlasses, bows and arrows. Subsequently,  GF/NPF recovered the dead body of a male civilian in the morning and moved it to Babbangida hospital. GF also moved 15 injured civilians to the hospital.

Herdsmen armed with handguns, machetes **knife attack* attack*, sticks, bows and arrows attacked civilians and farmers in the village. GF/NPF from Gashua town deployed and exchanged fire with them until the herdsmen retreated.  The herdsmen shot and injured one GF member and 12 civilians during the armed clash.
Criminals *burlary* the private residence of an INGO staff member while he was away. They *theft / mugging* two laptops, money, clothing, jewelry and damaged the furniture.

OAG operatives with rifles and knives entered the town. They identified, apprehended *arrest* *arrest* and executed three herdsmen by slitting their throats. Reportedly, the herdsmen failed to pay the informal tax imposed on them by the operatives.

OAG operatives with rifles approached a GF/NA position in the location, prompting GF/NA and GF/CJTF members to open fire at them. The armed clash lasted for a few minutes until the operatives withdrew. During the armed clash, the operatives shot and injured two GF/NA members while GF shot and killed two operatives, recovered two rifles and one locally made gun.
Three ‘Kalare’ gang members armed with knives injured a male motorized tricycle driver and robbed him of money along the street.

Suspected Kidnap and Kidnap/Abductionionpers armed with handguns aboard three motorcycles arrived at a private residence and attempted to Kidnap/Abduction a male civilian. Nearby vigilantes sighted and exchanged fire with them until the criminals retreated and abandoned a motorcycle.

A group of motorized tricycle drivers armed with sticks and machetes **knife attack* attack*' gathered at their associations office and threatened to set up a parallel office which resulted in a disagreement. GF/NPF deployed and fired teargas, prompting the crowd to disperse. Subsequently, the traditional leader of the area announced the immediate suspension of commercial tricycle activities within the town until further notice.
Criminals *theft / mugging* a motorized tricycle parked along a street.
Two children picked up a UXO in the vicinity of 20 Housing unit. While they were handling the ordnance it exploded, injuring them.

ISWAP  operatives with rifles aboard four light trucks mounted with HMGs attacked a GF/NA position in the vicinity of Gajiganna axis. GF exchanged fire with the operatives, fired several mortar bombs at them and subsequently deployed Close Air Support (CAS) which prompted the operatives to retreat. Casualty figures are unknown. ISWAP claimed the attack via Amaq on 09.01.2021.

A GF/NA vehicle that was part of a GF convoy in transit, hit an  ISWAP  road-planted IED along a secondary road. The explosion injured four GF members and damaged the vehicle. Shortly after, another GF/NA vehicle hit a second IED a few meters away from the first scene. The explosion injured two GF members and damaged the vehicle. ISWAP claimed the attack via Amaq on 09.01.2021.
GF/NAF conducted airstrikes against a suspected OAG camp. They killed at least three suspected operatives and destroyed buildings.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an *IVCP* along the road. They stopped several commercial vehicles in transit and robbed the passengers of money and other valuables. GF Close Air Support (CAS) approached the scene which prompted the operatives to retreat.

OAG operatives with rifles infiltrated this area, asked questions regarding the whereabouts of GF members and subsequently set on fire a health facility and a borehole before withdrawing. No casualties were reported.
A male criminal raped *SEA* a nine-year-old girl in a private residence. Nearby civilians apprehended *arrest* *arrest* and handed him over to GF/NPF.

GF/NA following a tip-off arrested a female civilian suspected of being an OAG BBIED carrier. She was sighted attempting to enter the town by civilians working on the outskirts of the town who immediately notified the GF. Subsequently, GF arrested her for further interrogation, however no explosive vest was found on her. After the interrogation, the suspect revealed the location where she had hid her explosive vest on 10.01.2021.
GF/CJTF together with vigilantes on patrol encountered OAG operatives and exchanged fire with them. GF killed three operatives and recovered one rifle, one motorcycle and foodstuff.
Two groups of Fulani herdsmen armed with machetes **knife attack* attack* clashed with each other in the market, following a disagreement. Three male herdsmen were injured during the clash.
Nigerian Drug Law Enforcement Agency (NDLEA) members during an operation arrested 11 male drug dealers in possession of narcotics.

OAG operatives with rifles on foot approached this location and shot sporadically at fishermen. As a result one male fisherman was killed, while others managed to escape.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an *IVCP* along this road. They stopped several commercial vehicles in transit and robbed the passengers of money and other valuables before allowing them to continue their journey.
OAG operatives with rifles shot and killed nine civilians while they were fetching firewood.  Two other civilians were declared missing.

ISWAP  operatives with rifles aboard two motorcycles and four vehicles mounted with HMGs *ambush* a convoy of GF/NA on transit along the road while a BBIED carrier detonated. GF exchanged fire with them for several minutes and eventually retreated to Gujba town. During the exchange of fire, the operatives reportedly killed eight GF members while several others were declared missing. The operatives also set on fire three GF vehicles, at least two construction equipment and subsequently went after the GF members and attacked Gujba town. ISWAP claimed the attack via Amaq on 10.01.2021.

ISWAP  operatives *armed attack* a GF position prompting local hunters in the location to return fire. The exchange lasted briefly until the local hunters withdraw. During the exchange, the operatives killed two local hunters, injured another and seized two vehicles. ISWAP claimed the attack via Amaq on 09.01.2021.

ISWAP  operatives with rifles aboard vehicles mounted with HMGs infiltrated the town, fired shots into the air and set on fire a public primary school. They also approached a health facility managed by an INGO, which prompted staff and some patients to flee. Afterwards, the operatives *theft / mugging* an ambulance at the facility and a vehicle within the town before they withdrew towards the eastern outskirts of Kasachia. Shortly after, GF/NA reinforcement team from Damaturu town trailed and exchanged fire with them until the operatives retreated. GF killed 28 operatives, seized weaponry and two OAG vehicles while the operatives killed one GF member and injured another. Reportedly, GF also recovered the *theft / mugging*n ambulance with its windscreen damaged, while the operatives escaped with the vehicle. This incident followed an OAG ambush at Kasachia along Gujba-Buni Yadi road at about 1500hrs.ISWAP claimed the attack via Amaq on 10.01.2021.

Criminals *burlary* a shop within this market and *theft / mugging* a bag containing money, phone and other valuables while the shop attendant was not paying attention. The victim reported the incident to GF/NPF. No arrest was made.
Three ‘Kalare’ gang members armed with knives robbed a male civilian of money and other valuables in front of his shop.
‘Shilla’ gang members standing along the street snatched a purse from a female civilian while she was aboard a moving motorized tricycle.
Criminals armed with handguns set up an *IVCP* along this road. They stopped at least five commercial vehicles in transit and robbed passengers of their money and other valuables.

Suspected  Kidnap/Abductionion  Kidnap/Abductionion Abductionionpers armed with handguns and machetes **knife attack* attack* *burglary* into a private residence and  Kidnap/Abductionion  Kidnap/Abductionion Abductionion a male civilian. They also shot and injured the son of the victim while the wife was also injured with a machete.

GF/NA following a tip-off, rescued a  male civilian on the outskirts of this area. The victim had been Kidnap/Kidnap/Abductionion by suspected Kidnap/Kidnap/Abductionionpers in Michika town on 08.01.2021.
Vigilantes apprehended *arrest* *arrest* six male criminals and recovered knives and machetes **knife attack* attack* from them. They later handed over the criminals to GF/NPF.
Criminals *burlary* a private residence and *theft / mugging* a generator kept outside while the occupants were asleep.
Criminals *burlary* a private residence and *theft / mugging* a television set and other valuables while the occupants were asleep.

GF/NA on patrol recovered an OAG road-planted IED and safely disposed of it via controlled detonation. Thereafter, GF proceeded to Kawuri village along the road. On their way back to Konduga town, OAG operatives hiding nearby remotely detonated an IED in the same location, the explosion killed one GF member and injured another before the operatives retreated. Subsequently, GF recovered additional five road planted IEDs and safely disposed of it via controlled detonation. No contact was reported between the GF and operatives.

GF/NA recovered an OAG IED vest hidden inside the bush on the outskirts of this area. A suspected female BBIED carrier apprehended *arrest* *arrest* on 08.01.2021, had provided information on the location of the device during an interrogation.

ISWAP  operatives with rifles, aboard several light trucks mounted with HMGs and two SVBIEDs attacked GF/NA in transit along a secondary road, prompting GF to return fire. One SVBIED detonated next to a GF/NA light armored vehicle. The explosion destroyed the GF/NA vehicle, killed four GF/NA members aboard it, the operatives also destroyed a drone and communication gadgets. The operatives shot and killed one GF member and injured 17 others. While GF killed six operatives, injured at least two others, seized one vehicle, weapons, and destroyed one VBIED and two vehicles. ISWAP claimed the attack via Amaq on 10.01.2021.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an *IVCP* along this road. They stopped several commercial vehicles in transit and robbed the passengers of money and other valuables. The operatives sighted a GF/CJTF vehicle together with vigilantes in transit and opened fire at them, prompting GF/CJTF and vigilantes to return fire until the operatives retreated. During the armed clash GF killed two operatives. The passengers recovered some of their valuables and continued to Monguno town.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an *IVCP* along this road. They stopped a commercial vehicle in transit, carjacked the vehicle and Kidnap/Kidnap/Abductionion the driver and four other passengers onboard.

ISWAP  operatives with rifles aboard several light trucks mounted with HMGs attacked a GF/NA position. GF returned fire and subsequently deployed Close Air Support (CAS) prompting the operatives to retreat. During the armed clash, the operatives reportedly killed two GF members, injured another and seized one GF vehicle. ISWAP claimed the attack via Amaq on 11.01.2021.

Criminals armed with handguns entered a residence and  Kidnap/Abductionion  Kidnap/Abductionion Abductionion a male civilian.

OAG operatives with rifles aboard eight motorcycles occupied this location for about 10 hours and eventually left without harming anyone.
Criminals armed with handguns gained access to a private residence and  Kidnap/Abductionion  Kidnap/Abductionion Abductionion a male civilian.
Criminals *burlary* a shop and *theft / mugging* seven bags of rice and other valuables.
At least seven ‘Kalare’ gang members armed with knives and machetes **knife attack* attack* *burglary* into two private residences and robbed the occupants of their money and other valuables.

‘Kalare’ gang members armed with knives and machetes **knife attack* attack* *burglary* into a residence and attempted to rob the occupants. The occupants resisted, prompting the criminals to injure two male occupants before they subsequently withdrew.

OAG operatives with rifles aboard eight motorcycles set up an *IVCP* along this road. They stopped six commercial vehicles in transit and robbed the passengers of phones, money and other valuables before subsequently allowing them to continue their journey.

GF/NA on patrol recovered three OAG road-planted IED and safely disposed of it via controlled detonation.

GF/NPF acting on a tip-off arrested a male criminal and recovered a *theft / mugging*n car from him. Earlier in the morning, the criminal using a blunt weapon robbed and injured a male civilian of his car at Federal Housing Estate.
A civilian vehicle in a GF-escorted convoy in transit ran over an OAG road-planted IED along the road. The explosion killed two female civilians, injured six others and damaged the vehicle.
GF/NAF conducted airstrikes against a suspected OAG camp. They killed at least three operatives, and destroyed OAG buildings.

OAG operatives with rifles and knives on four motorcycles entered the area, shot and killed a male civilian, and injured another with a *knife attack* before they left the area. GF/CJTF deployed to the area and recovered the corpse and the injured civilian.
OAG operatives with rifles set up an *IVCP* along this road. They stopped a commercial vehicle in transit and carjacked it and Kidnap/Kidnap/Abductionion the driver.

GF/CJTF together with vigilantes armed with handguns on patrol encountered OAG operatives and exchanged fire with them until the operatives retreated. GF killed three operatives, recovered one rifle and one locally made gun.
GF/CJTF following a tip-off arrested a male civilian suspected of being an OAG informant.
Criminals *burlary* a private residence and *theft / mugging* mobile phones while the occupants were asleep.

Vigilantes on patrol apprehended *arrest* *arrest* a male criminal and recovered a bicycle he had *theft / mugging*n at a private residence in Sabon Fegi earlier. The vigilantes handed over the criminal to GF/NPF. The criminal had attempted to pick up the bicycle from where he hid it.
GF/NAF conducted airstrikes against a suspected OAG camp. They killed at least two operatives and destroyed OAG buildings.
GF/NA following a tip-off recovered one AK-47 rifle and two UXOs buried in a culvert. Reportedly, civilians on a routine environmental sanitation activity recovered it and notified the GF.

GF/NA on patrol recovered 12 OAG road-planted IEDs and safely disposed of it via controlled detonation. OAG operatives hiding in a nearby bush opened fire at them prompting GF to return fire until the operatives retreated. No casualties reported.
OAG operatives with rifles set up an *IVCP* along this road. They stopped several commercial vehicles in transit and robbed the passengers of money and other valuables.

The operatives arrived through two axes: one group approached the â€˜super campâ€™ base from the northern axis while a second group accessed the base from the north-eastern axis. They exchanged fire with GF members for over one hour until GF vacated their base and retreated towards Ajiri along with several IO and NGO staff members. Concurrently, another group of operatives attacked the other GF base, prompting GF to vacate the position. They seized weaponry and set on fire some buildings within the base. Alongside, another GF contingent present in the city engaged the operatives, until the GF retreated to the outskirts of the town. Subsequently, GF deployed Close Air Support (CAS). The operatives maintained presence in the town and asked civilians not to flee, as they were only targeting GF members. The operatives observed prayers in the town. About 40 minutes later, the GF contingent that had retreated to the outskirts came back to engage the operatives. The exchange of fire lasted for several minutes until the GF retreated once again. During the armed clash, the operatives shot and killed 10 GF members, injured at least six others, seized vehicles and weaponry. Two civilians died and at least four others sustained injuries as a result of the crossfire while at least three NGO workers sustained psychological trauma following the incident. The operatives maintained their presence in town until 01:00hrs and then withdrew. ISWAP claimed the attack via Amaq on 20.02.2021.

ISWAP  operatives with rifles aboard several light trucks mounted with HMGs and motorcycles attacked two GF/NA bases including the ‘super camp formation’ within the town. The operatives arrived through two axes: one group approached the ‘super camp’ base from the northern axis while the second group accessed the base from the north-eastern axis. They exchanged fire with GF members for over one hour until GF vacated their base and retreated towards Ajiri. Concurrently, another group of operatives attacked one other GF base, prompting GF to vacate the position. While at the base, the operatives seized GF vehicles (including one CJTF vehicle), weaponry and set on fire some buildings within the base. Additionally, the operatives engaged another contingent of GF/NA, causing the GF members to retreat from the town. The operatives then proceeded to an IO compound, damaged the entrance gate using explosives and gained access into the compound. Some of the operatives maintained presence in the compound while others stayed within the town. During the armed clash, the operatives shot and killed at least six GF/NA members and injured at least five others. At least six civilians died in the crossfire while five others sustained injuries. At approximately 0700hrs on 02.03.2021, the operatives set on fire a building in the IO compound. Concurrently, other operatives proceeded to several NGO compounds (offices and guesthouses), seized vehicles and set on fire at least three. The operatives also set on fire a governmental health facility supported by NGOs. Several NGO staff members managed to escape before the operatives entered their compounds. The operatives also set on fire several houses including the emir’s palace and a few politicians’ residences. Several groups of operatives proceeded to the IDP camps, gathered IDPs and preached their doctrine, scrutinized them and subsequently Kidnap/Kidnap/Abductionion at least three civilians. At approximately 0900hrs, another group of the operatives *ambush* a GF convoy that was approaching the town from Ajiri axis. The armed clash lasted for a few minutes until GF retreated. Eventually, the operatives left the town at approximately 1100hrs. ISWAP claimed the attack via Amaq on 02.03.2021.

ISWAP  operatives *armed attack* a GF/NA position prompting GF to return fire. The fire exchange lasted for several minutes until GF vacated their position. During the armed clash, the operatives shot and killed one GF/NA member, one GF/NPF member and set on fire a civilian house and two vehicles. The operatives maintained presence in the town until 0100hrs on 02.03.2021. ISWAP claimed the attack via Amaq on 02.03.2021.

ISWAP  operatives with rifles aboard several light trucks mounted with HMGs approached the town through two different axes. One group engaged the GF/NA ‘Super Camp’ from Kukawa axis, prompting GF to return fire. The second group attacked the GF/NA position at the entrance of the town (along Maiduguri road axis), killing at least three GF/NA members and injuring at least four others, which caused other GF/NA to vacate the position and retract towards the super camp. Subsequently, the operatives entered the town. Some elements proceeded to the Humanitarian Hub area, *looting* goods from an NGO warehouse and set it on fire, while others moved to residential areas. At approximately 1640hrs, shortly after the deployment of a GF Close Air Support (CAS) component, some of the operatives temporarily retreated from the town and moved towards Maiduguri road axis. The CAS engaged them, killing at least eight OAG operatives and forcing others to disperse. A few minutes later, the operatives regrouped and returned to the town. While in the residential areas, the operatives forced some civilians to identify NGOs and Community leaders’ residences. Immediately after, they set on fire two NGO offices and one other NGO guesthouse. The operatives also *looting* some medical supplies in a health facility supported by an NGO. At approximately 1900hrs, GF from the ‘super camp’ deployed and engaged the operatives. The armed clash lasted for a few minutes until the operatives retreated. Additionally, stray bullets killed at least six civilians (including one male NGO NAP) and injured at least two others (one female and one male).

ISWAP  operatives with rifles aboard several light trucks mounted with HMGs infiltrated Geidam town from the eastern axis, gathered civilians in the town, preached their doctrine and shared fliers urging them to join the group and stay in the town or leave if not willing.  The operatives maintained a presence in the town and set markets and shops ablaze. Thereafter, a part of the operatives in Geidam town attacked GF/NA base located on the outskirts of Geidam, prompting GF to return fire and deployed Close Air Support (CAS). The exchange lasted for several minutes and during the armed clash, the operatives shot and killed at least two GF. Eventually, the operatives retreated to the town to join the other group, where they maintained presence till 25.04.2021. While in the town, and on 24.04.2021 they set ablaze the house of the Emir, civilian vehicles, a fire service truck, construction equipment and two communication masts. The operatives also fired a projectile that landed in a residential area and killed at least 11 civilians. Subsequently, the operatives hoisted their flags, planted Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) around the town before they temporarily retreated. On 25.04.2021, GF/NA deployed and engaged the operatives on the outskirts of the town until the operatives retreated into the town. During the armed clash, GF shot and killed at least five operatives and seized at least two OAG vehicles. Upon returning to the town, the operatives targeted and slaughtered two male teachers (one of them was a Christian). They also *burlary* shops, *looting* foodstuff and destroyed several shops. Additionally, the operatives hijacked an IO truck loaded with supplies and *looting* the supplies. Thereafter, the operatives temporarily retreated from the town at about midday. They later returned into the town in the evening and maintained their presence. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the operatives planted IEDs in different areas – a tactic that ISWAP has employed in the past to delay and inflict casualties on GF/NA reinforcements. ISWAP claimed the attack via Amaq on 24.04.2021.

The other passenger replied that the suspected civilian was a Muslim.
