The exchange lasted for several minutes until the operatives retreated. During the armed clash, GF/NA stationed in Bama fired two heavy artillery projectiles towards the direction of the armed clash. The outcome was unknown.

GF/NA fired three heavy artillery projectiles towards Firgi upon sighting large number of suspected OAG operatives aboard vehicles crossing the road to Sambisa Forest. The outcome was unknown. Concurrently, GF/NA fired one heavy artillery projectile from Pulka towards the same target.

GF/NA fired one heavy artillery projectile towards Firgi upon sighting large number of suspected OAG operatives aboard vehicles crossing the road to Sambisa Forest. The outcome was unknown. Concurrently, GF/NA fired three heavy artillery projectiles from Banki Junction towards the same target.
OAG operatives with rifles entered a farmland and fired shots into the air, prompting the farmers to flee. No casualties were reported.
A GF/NA vehicle in transit along a secondary road hit an OAG road-planted IED. The explosion killed two GF members, injured at least four others, including one CJTF member and damaged the vehicle.
Criminals armed with knives broke into a private residence and robbed the occupants of foodstuff. They also injured one male civilian who resisted.

OAG/ISWAP operatives with rifles on motorcycles attacked a GF/CJTF position at the entrance of an IDP camp, prompting GF to return fire. The exchange lasted for several minutes until GF/CJTF eventually vacated their position. Subsequently, the operatives set the position on fire and seized three mobile phones abandoned by the GF/CJTF. During the armed clash, three civilians (two males and one child) sustained injuries as a result of the crossfire. ISWAP claimed the attack via Amaq on 07.06.2021.
A male criminal burgled a private residence and stole one mobile phone. Civilians apprehended the criminal several hours later and recovered the stolen item.
GF/NA restricted vehicular movements along the road until 1200hrs. The restriction was linked to GF operations in the general area.
OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. The VCP lasted for an unspecified amount of time. Eventually the operatives withdrew. The outcome was unknown.
GF/NA recovered an OAG road-planted IED and safely disposed of it via controlled detonation.

Following a tip-off from an employer, GF/NPF arrested eight male employees suspected to be involved in the stealing of PolyVinyl Chloride (PVC) pipes used to repair the toilets at the IDP camp. IO sponsored the project in the IDP camp.

A male GF/CJTF member walking along a secondary road stepped on an OAG road-planted IED. The explosion killed him. The GF/CJTF member was escorting civilians who were excavating the trench at the time of the incident. Civilians fled into the town upon hearing the explosion.
Following a tip-off, civilians apprehended a male criminal at a market and recovered a phone he had stolen on 06.07.2021 in the same area. The civilians later handed him over to GF/NPF.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped several commercial vehicles in transit and asked for the passengersâ€™ identifications before allowing them to continue their journey. No robberies or abductions were reported.

OAG operatives with rifles aboard light trucks mounted with HMGs set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped three commercial vehicles in transit and abducted at least 15 passengers before withdrawing. The operatives subsequently profiled the abductees and released all of them two hours later.
A male criminal entered a shelter in an IDP camp and stole foodstuff. While leaving, nearby civilians apprehended him, recovered the stolen items and handed him over to GF/NPF.
Criminals discreetly entered a residence and kidnapped a male civilian. Later they demanded a ransom. The criminals released the civilian on 09.07.2021 upon the payment of a ransom.

Criminals gained access to the private residence of an INGO staff member by jumping over the perimeter fence at night and stole mobile phones, laptops, and other valuables while the occupants were asleep. No injuries were reported.
Criminals gained access to a residence by jumping over the perimeter fence and rustled livestock.
Criminals burgled a residence and stole mobile phones and electronic devices while the occupants were asleep.

OAG/ISWAP operatives with rifles aboard several light trucks mounted with HMGs entered the location, shot and killed at least 14 civilians and set two churches on fire. They also looted foodstuff and valuables before withdrawing. Reportedly, the operatives actively searched for Christian residents during the attack. ISWAP claimed the attack via Amaq on 08.07.2021 as an attack against the Christian community.
Herdsmen encroached on a farm with their cattle and destroyed crops. No confrontations or injuries were reported.
Civilians recovered the dead body of a male civilian in a bush. The circumstances surrounding the victim's death remained unknown.
OAG operatives with rifles entered a farmland on the outskirts of the area, fired shots into the air and abducted a female farmer while others fled.

Motorised tricycle riders staged a demonstration against Yobe Road Transportation Management Agency (YOROTA) over alleged extortion and harassment. The protesters pelted stones at YOROTA's building and damaged several windows. Subsequently, GF/NPF deployed to the area, dispersed the protesters and arrested eight of them.

OAG/ISWAP operatives with rifles ambushed a GF/NA-escorted civilian convoy in transit along the road, prompting GF to return fire. The exchange lasted for several minutes until the operatives retreated. During the armed clash, the operatives shot and killed three GF members and seized two GF vehicles. ISWAP claimed the attack via Amaq on 07.06.2021.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road and stopped several commercial vehicles in transit. They asked for the passengersâ€™ identifications and siphoned fuel from the vehicles before allowing them to continue their journey. No abductions were reported.

OAG operatives with rifles aboard two light trucks mounted with HMGs and on two motorcycles attacked a GF/NA position, prompting GF to return fire. The exchange lasted for several minutes until the operatives retreated. During the armed clash, the operatives shot and killed one GF member and seized one GF vehicle. In addition, three civilians died as a result of the crossfire.
Criminals armed with machetes waved a motorcycle rider along a street, prompting him to stop. They injured and robbed him of his motorcycle and other valuables.

OAG operatives with rifles aboard light trucks mounted with HMGs attacked a GF/NA position, prompting GF to return fire. The exchange lasted for over an hour until GF/NA deployed a reinforcement team from Bama that caused the operatives to retreat. The outcome was unknown.
GF/NA fired one heavy artillery projectile towards Ngulda upon sighting suspected OAG movements.

OAG operatives with rifles aboard several light trucks mounted with HMGs ordered residents of a fishermen village to leave the area, indicating that they were planning to conduct an attack in the location. The civilians complied and left while the operatives maintained presence in the area until 08.07.2021 before withdrawing. No information on whether the residents were able to come back to the village was available.

OAG operatives with rifles infiltrated the area, fired shots into the air, broke into private residences and robbed the occupants of foodstuff and other valuables. They also looted foodstuff and other valuables from shops. No casualties were reported.

Criminals rustled livestock from a yard of a 
private residence.
Criminals burgled three shops and stole money and other valuables.
Criminals burgled a private residence and stole a TV set and other valuables.
Criminals burgled a residence and stole money and a mobile phone.
A male criminal armed with a stick injured an unarmed civilian during a farmland dispute. Shortly after, GF/NPF arrived to the scene and arrested both of them.

OAG/ISWAP operatives with rifles aboard six light trucks mounted with HMGs approached the area from Goniri axis and attacked a GF/NA position, prompting GF to return fire. The exchange lasted for several minutes until a GF reinforcement team deployed, causing the operatives to retreat abandoning two vehicles at the location. While retreating, the operatives fired shots into the air when passing by Gujba. During the armed clash, the operatives shot and killed two GF members while a female civilian and her male child sustained injuries as a result of the crossfire. GF/NA restricted vehicular movements along Damaturu-Biu road during the incident. ISWAP claimed responsiblity for the attack via Amaq on 09.07.2021.
GF/NA restricted vehicular movements along the road until 1200hrs. The restriction was linked to an OAG attack in Katarko.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road and stopped several commercial vehicles in transit. They asked for the passengersâ€™ identifications and siphoned fuel from the vehicles before subsequently allowing them to continue their journey. The operatives also asked one driver to run errands for them. The driver refused, prompting the operatives to threaten to beat him up. Eventually, they allowed him to continue his journey after he pleaded with them. No abductions were reported.
OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal tax collection point along the road where the herdsmen came and willingly paid informal taxes. The operatives did not stop any vehicles in transit.
A male OAG operative approached a GF/CJTF position on the outskirts of the town and surrendered. GF/NA members took him into custody.

OAG/ISWAP operatives with rifles aboard several light trucks mounted with HMGs set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped several commercial vehicles in transit and asked for the passengersâ€™ identifications. The operatives identified a female civilian suspected to be a Christian and abducted her. They also stopped two commercial vehicles and temporarily abducted all the passengers before withdrawing. Six hours later, the operatives released all the abductees, except for the suspected Christian female. Concurrently, another group of ISWAP operatives attacked a GF/NPF checkpoint in the same location. ISWAP claimed both the attack and the VCP via Amaq on 08.07.2021.

OAG/ISWAP operatives with rifles aboard several light trucks mounted with HMGs attacked a GF/NPF position, prompting GF to return fire. The exchange lasted for several minutes until GF vacated the position. During the armed clash, the operatives shot and killed one GF/NPF member. The operatives set a GF/NPF vehicle on fire before withdrawing towards the southern axis. Subsequently, GF/NAF deployed Close Air Support (CAS) against the OAG vehicles. The outcome of the airstrikes was unknown. Concurrently, another group of ISWAP operatives set up an informal vehicle checkpoint in the same location. ISWAP claimed both the attack and the VCP via Amaq on 08.07.2021.

Suspected OAG operatives with rifles entered a farmland, gathered 10 male farmers and searched them. The operatives found drugs in possession of three of them. They shot and killed one of the three for resisting and abducted the two others. They released the remaining seven.

OAG operatives with rifles entered the town, gathered the residents and preached their doctrine to them. In addition, they warned them against reporting OAG activities to GF. They also temporarily detained two male civilians suspected to be civil servants, profiled them and released them.
Criminals rustled livestock from a residence. The male owner trailed the stolen livestock and found it abandoned in the bush. He recovered the livestock but the criminals remained at large.

A vigilante vehicle hit an OAG/ISWAP road-planted IED while in transit along the road. The explosion partly damaged the vehicle and injured one vigilante member. Shortly after, GF/NA deployed and evacuated the vigilantes. ISWAP claimed the attack on 08.07.2021.

OAG/ISWAP operatives fired at least seven projectiles suspected to be light mortar bombs into the GF base in the town. At least three of the projectiles landed within the base. The resulting explosions killed three GF members and injured two others, while the remaining projectiles landed in an open space near the base. ISWAP claimed the attack via Amaq on 15.07.2021.
Criminals released a male civilian whom they had kidnapped in Mubi on 06.07.2021 upon the payment of a ransom.

A group of tanker truck drivers staged a protest and blocked the roads in the area until 0900hrs. The protesters were lamenting an alleged extortion of money from tanker truck drivers by members of Federal Road Safety Corps (FRSC). No arrests were reported.
Herders armed with machetes and handguns attacked and killed two male farmers on a farmland.
GF/NA restricted vehicular movements along the road. The reason for the restriction was unknown.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped several commercial vehicles in transit and asked for the passengers' identifications before allowing them to continue their journey. No abductions or robberies were reported.

GF/NA on patrol made contact with OAG operatives with rifles riding five motorcycles and engaged them while they were crossing the road. The exchange lasted for a few minutes until the operatives retreated. During the armed clash, GF killed one operative, seized one motorcycle and a rifle.
GF/NA restricted vehicular movements along the road. The reason for the restriction was unknown.

A large number of civilians staged a protest against the state authority and blocked a section of the road. The protesters called for justice over the alleged reoccurring killings of civilians by suspected armed Fulani herdsmen. Shortly after, GF/NA and GF/NPF personnel deployed to the area and forcefully dispersed the protesters.
‘Kalare’  gang members armed with machetes attacked and injured four male civilians, who were sitting in front of a shop, for unknown reasons.
A male criminal attempted to burgle a private residence. Nearby civilians caught him in the act, beat him up and left the criminal at the scene.
Criminals burgled three different residences and rustled rams.
A male criminal attempted to burgle a  private residence. Nearby civilians sighted, apprehended and beat him up to death.

A male criminal rustled three sheep from a yard of a private residence on the outskirts of the area. Vigilantes apprehended him and recovered two sheep and one already slaughtered at 1400hrs on the same day in Buni Yadi.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped several commercial vehicles in transit and asked for the passengers' identifications before allowing them to continue their journey. No abductions or robberies were reported.
GF/NA restricted vehicular movements in and out of the town and along the road. The reason for the restriction was unknown.
GF/NA recovered an OAG road-planted IED and safely disposed of it via controlled detonation.
Five suspected OAG family members (two females, two boys and a girl) approached a GF/NA position and surrendered.

OAG/ISWAP operatives with rifles ambushed a GF/NA vehicle in transit along the road, prompting GF to return fire. Shortly after, a GF/NA reinforcement team arrived and engaged the operatives, causing them to retreat. During the armed clash, the operatives killed two GF members and injured three others. ISWAP claimed the attack via Amaq on 10.07.2021.
Criminals stole a bicycle parked in front of a private residence.

Vigilantes on patrol apprehended a male criminal along the road, recovered two sheep and one already slaughtered. Vigilantes handed the criminal over to GF/NPF. The criminal had rustled the livestock from a private residence at Kokuwa earlier the same day.
Criminals aboard a motorised tricycle rustled livestock that was grazing along a street.

‘Kalare’ gang members armed with machetes and sticks injured 10 civilians, damaged several tents and valuables belonging to a rival political party. The attack took place during a meeting held by the opposing politicians.

OAG operatives with rifles aboard light trucks mounted with HMGs attacked a GF/NA checkpoint along the road, prompting GF/NA to return fire. The exchange lasted for several minutes until GF vacated the checkpoint. The operatives subsequently seized a GF/NA vehicle and weaponry. Shortly after, GF/NA reinforcement team arrived at area and exchanged fire with the operatives for several minutes until they retreated abandoning a GF/NA vehicle. During the armed clash, the operatives shot and killed two GF members and injured one other.
Criminals walked into an INGO warehouse through a gate that had been broken due to heavy rainfall and stole Non-Food Items (NFIs).

GF/NA fired at least two heavy artillery projectiles towards the outskirts of Lawanti upon sighting suspected OAG movements. Five hours later, GF deployed to the area and exchanged fire with the operatives until they retreated. The outcome was unknown.

OAG/ISWAP operatives with rifles approached a GF/NA position at the trench and fired shots, prompting GF/NA to respond. The exchange lasted for several minutes until the operatives retreated. No casualties were reported. ISWAP claimed the attack via Amaq on 12.07.2021.

GF/NA vehicle hit an OAG/ISWAP road-planted IED near a GF/NA position. The explosion injured two GF members and damaged the vehicle. The GF/NA vehicle hit the device while parking at the position. ISWAP claimed the incident via Amaq on 10.07.2021.
Four female suspected OAG family members approached a GF/NA position and surrendered.
GF/NA recovered an OAG road-planted IED and safely disposed of it via controlled detonation.

GF/NAF conducted airstrikes against suspected gathering of OAG operatives in the area. The outcome was unknown. During the airstrikes, GF/NA restricted vehicular movements in and out of Benisheikh and along the road.
GF/NA restricted vehicular movements in and out of the town and along the road until 0900hrs. The restriction was linked to GF/NAF airstrikes in Lamboa.
A male criminal burgled a private residence and stole a mobile phone. Nearby civilians sighted, apprehended him, recovered the stolen item and then released him.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped several commercial vehicles in transit and asked for the passengers’ identifications before allowing them to continue their journey. No abductions or robberies were reported.

OAG operatives with rifles infiltrated the area and attacked a GF/CJTF position in front of an IDP camp, prompting GF/CJTF to return fire. The exchange lasted for few minutes until the operatives retreated. No casualties were reported.

OAG/ISWAP operatives with rifles aboard two vehicles infiltrated the settlement and made contact with vigilantes, prompting the vigilantes to return fire. The exchange lasted for several minutes until the vigilantes retreated. During the armed clash, the operatives shot and killed two vigilante members and damaged one vigilante’s vehicle. ISWAP claimed the attack via Amaq on 15.07.2021.
GF/NA fired machine guns towards Yaleri Kurna axis upon sighting suspected OAG movements. No casualties were reported.

OAG/ISWAP operatives with rifles on five motorcycles attacked a GF/NA position on the southern outskirts of the town, prompting GF to return fire. The exchange lasted for several minutes until the operatives retreated. During the armed clash, the operatives killed one GF/NA member, injured one other and one GF/NPF(Mopol) personnel. Two civilians, including one IDP, sustained injuries as a result of the crossfire. ISWAP claimed the attack via Amaq on 12.07.2021.

OAG operatives with rifles on foot attacked a GF/NA position along Majwa road, prompting GF to return fire. The exchange lasted for few minutes until the operatives retreated. No casualties were reported.
Four male criminals rustled four rams from a yard of a private residence. Vigilantes apprehended them and recovered the stolen livestock on 12.07.2021.

OAG operatives with rifles aboard two light trucks mounted with HMGs infiltrated the area. They shot and killed one male civilian in his residence, abducted three other male civilians and left the remaining residents unharmed.
Suspected OAG operatives with rifles broke into a private residence and rustled cattle.
Criminals burgled a shop, stole foodstuff and other valuables.
Criminals burgled a private residence and stole three mobile phones while the occupants were asleep.
A criminal burgled a private residence and stole a mobile phone while the occupants were asleep.
Criminals burgles a private residence and stole a bicycle.
Two male OAG operatives together with two female suspected OAG family members approached a GF/NA position and surrendered.
Vigilantes, acting on a tip-off, apprehended four male criminals while they were attempting to sell rams that they had stolen at Kasuwar Shanu on 11.07.21. Vigilantes also recovered the stolen rams.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped several commercial vehicles in transit and asked for the passengers’ identifications before allowing them to continue their journey. No abductions or robberies were reported.
A male criminal armed with a handgun shot and killed a female civilian following a family-related dispute.
OAG operatives with rifles entered this location on motorcycles. They gathered the residents and forcefully collected money as informal taxes.

Following a tip-off, civilians apprehended two male suspected criminals from a hideout located inside a market and recovered allegedly stolen items. Subsequently they handed over the criminals and the items to GF/NPF.

Six OAG operatives with rifles on three motorcycles infiltrated the town, gathered the residents in a mosque and preached their doctrine to them until 1950hrs. Reportedly, the operatives talked about 'Jihad rules' and called on locals to do righteous things. They eventually withdrew without harming anyone.
Criminals armed with handguns broke into a private residence and abducted a female civilian.

A male criminal armed with sticks waved a motorcycle rider along a street, prompting him to stop. He injured him and attempted to rob the rider of his motorcycle. Nearby civilians pursued, apprehended the criminal and handed him over to GF/NPF.
‘Shilla’ gang members armed with knives injured two male civilians and robbed them of mobile phones and money.

OAG operatives with rifles aboard light trucks mounted with HMGs attacked a GF/NA position, prompting GF to return fire. The exchange lasted for several minutes until the operatives retreated. During the armed clash, the operatives shot and killed two GF members and injured four others while GF killed at least two operatives.
Criminals armed with handguns broke into a private residence, kidnapped one male civilian and subsequently demanded a ransom.

OAG operatives with rifles aboard 16 light trucks mounted with HMGs infiltrated the town and maintained presence for several hours. While in town, the operatives passed along a message stating that any former OAG members who had surrendered to GF and gone through the deradicalisation program were "highly welcomed back to the Jihad struggle".

OAG/ISWAP operatives with rifles on foot infiltrated the town through the Walada/Jokka axis and attacked a GF/NA outpost, prompting GF/NA to return fire. The exchange lasted for several minutes until the operatives retreated. During the armed clash, the operatives reportedly shot and killed two GF members, seized two rifles and two motorcycles while GF shot and killed one operative and seized his rifle. ISWAP claimed the attack via Amaq on 13.07.2021.

GF/NA conducted a clearance operation against suspected OAG/ISWAP operatives, who were hibernating in the bush on the outskirts of the town after an attack on the location on the same day. They exchanged fire with them for several minutes until the operatives retreated. During the armed clash, the operatives reportedly shot and killed two GF/NA members and injured one other. The operatives also seized weaponry, a vehicle and two motorcycles from GF/NA. The operation followed an OAG/ISWAP attack against a GF post in the area on the same day at 0000hrs.
GF/NA restricted vehicular movements in and out of the town. The restriction followed an OAG attack in the area the same day at 0000hrs.

OAG operatives with rifles aboard vehicles infiltrated the area. They made contact with hunters who were patrolling the community. As as result of the armed clash, operatives shot and killed one hunter and injured two others. Shortly after, a GF/NA reinforcement team deployed to the location and engaged the operatives. The exchange lasted for several minutes until the operatives retreated. During the armed clash, GF/NA shot and killed five operatives.

OAG operatives (suspected to be from ISWAP) with rifles aboard vehicles infiltrated a market and apprehended two male civilians. They flogged them with sticks for the failure to comply with an OAG’s verdict that had been delivered on 12.07.21, following a disagreement between the two civilians. The operatives also threatened to apply a stiffer punishment on the two if they failed to accept the verdict and resolve the personal issue. Additionally, the operatives made an appeal to civilians, including commercial drivers, to always accept the OAG's judgement and to report any disagreement amongst themselves.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped several commercial vehicles in transit and asked for the passengers’ identifications. They identified one driver, beat him up with sticks for unknown reasons and subsequently warned him to stop plying the road. Two hours later, the operatives also stopped another commercial vehicle in transit and searched passengers’ luggage. They identified a bag containing some school documents and seized them.

Some staff of the Savannah Sugar Company beat up a GF/NSCDC member and disarmed him of his rifle after he prevented them from entering the company premises. The staff handed over the rifle to GF/NPF members. The GF/NSCDC member deployed to the company's premises following a tip-off of a planned protest by the residents of the area.
A male criminal sneaked into a shop and attempted to steal money. The shop owner apprehended and handed him over to GF/NPF.
Herdsmen armed with machetes encroached on a farmland with their cattle and destroyed crops. They also injured two male farmers that confronted them.

Criminals armed with handguns set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along a secondary road. They stopped five commercial vehicles in transit and robbed the passengers of money and other valuables before allowing them to continue their journey. No injuries were reported.
OAG operatives with rifles abducted a male civilian and rustled six cows from him. The operatives alleged he had stolen the cattle from an unknown location.
Criminals entered a yard of a private residence and rustled a ram.
A male criminal burgled a private residence and stole two mobile phones. While leaving, nearby civilians apprehended him, recovered the stolen item and handed him over to GF/NPF.

Two "Shilla" gang members armed with knives pretending to be regular passengers of a motorised tricycle robbed another male passenger of money and other valuables while in transit along a secondary road.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped commercial vehicles in transit and asked for the passengers’ identifications before allowing them to continue their journey. No abductions or robberies were reported.
Criminals aboard a motorised tricycle stopped by the roadside and rustled livestock that was grazing.
GF/NA restricted vehicular movements in and out of the town. The restriction was linked to the heightened OAG presence in the vicinity of Zawouram (Diffa, Niger) town on the Niger-Nigeria border.

‘Kalare’ gang members armed with sticks blocked the gates of the LGA secretariat, threatened to set on fire the building and attempted to extort money from the LGA chairman. Shortly after, GF/NPF deployed to the area and arrested two gang members while the others fled.
A male OAG operative approached a GF/CJTF position on the outskirts of the town and surrendered. Later, CJTF handed him over to GF/NA.
OAG operatives with rifles broke into a private residence, shot and killed two male civilians. During the incident, the operatives left the remaining residents unharmed.
A criminal stole a bicycle parked in front of a private residence.
Criminals gained access to a private residence by jumping over a fence and stole mobile phones and foodstuff while the occupants were away.
Suspected OAG operatives with rifles fired shots into the air and subsequently ransacked an abandoned house. They looted foodstuff and stole a bicycle.
Criminals burgled a private residence and stole clothes and foodstuff while the occupants were asleep.
GF/NA fired three heavy artillery projectiles towards Wumba axis upon sighting a suspected OAG gathering.

OAG/ISWAP operatives with rifles ambushed a GF/NA reinforcement team in transit along the road while on its way to Kawuri following an OAG/ISWAP attack against a GF/NA base. After a brief exchange of fire, GF/NA passed through the ambush and proceeded to Kawuri. During the ambush, one GF/NA vehicle hit an OAG/ISWAP road-planted IED. The explosion killed three GF members and damaged the vehicle. ISWAP claimed the attack on Kawuri and the ambush via Amaq on the same day.

OAG/ISWAP operatives with rifles attacked a GF/NA base, prompting GF to return fire. The exchange lasted for several minutes until GF vacated the position. The operatives entered the base, set it on fire along with at least four GF vehicles (two GF/NA, one GF/NPF and one vigilante vehicles). Shortly after, a GF/NA reinforcement team from Konduga town arrived at the location and engaged the operatives, prompting them to retreat. During the armed clash, the operatives shot and killed four GF/NA members and injured four others. Two GF/NPF members also sustained injuries. Additionally, the operatives seized weapons from the GF/NA base. ISWAP claimed the attack on Kawuri and the ambush via Amaq on the same day.
GF/NA fired four heavy artillery projectiles towards the Kawuri axis, following an OAG/ISWAP attack against GF/NA base in Kawuri.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped commercial vehicles in transit and asked for the passengers’ identifications before allowing them to continue their journey. No abductions or robberies were reported.

Five OAG operatives with rifles on two motorcycles stopped a male civilian, suspected to be a former CJTF member, and abducted him while he was walking along a secondary road on the outskirts of the town.
GF/NA restricted vehicular movements along the road until 1300hrs. The reason for the restriction was unknown.
GF/NA restricted vehicular movements along the road until 1300hrs. The reason for the restriction was unknown.

GF/NPF armed with sticks beat up some of the IDPs while they were arranging the people in the queue for the upcoming IO food distribution exercise. The battering sparked a violent protest which led to the stampede. 12 female civilians died and at least five others sustained injuries as a result of the incident. Subsequently, some of the IDPs proceeded to the IO compound and forcefully entered it. While in the compound, they damaged several IO vehicles and other valuables. GF/NPF and GF/NA personnel deployed to the compound and fired tear gas canisters, prompting the protesters to disperse.
GF/NA recovered three OAG road-planted IEDs and safely disposed of them via controlled detonations.
GF/NAF conducted airstrikes targeting suspected OAG vehicles. The outcome was unknown.
Criminals stole the windscreen of a motorised tricycle parked in front of a private residence.

OAG operatives with rifles aboard two light trucks mounted with HMGs attacked a GF/CJTF-manned checkpoint along the road, prompting GF/CJTF to return fire. The exchange lasted for a few minutes until GF/CJTF vacated the checkpoint. During the armed clash, the operatives shot and killed three GF/CJTF members, abducted one other, and seized one GF/CJTF vehicle. Shortly after, a GF/NA reinforcement team from Monguno deployed to the location and exchanged fire with the operatives, prompting them to retreat.

A large number of civilians -mostly youth- staged a protest in front of Savannah Sugar Company, demanding the management of the company to employ community members with "indigenous cards". The protesters gathered in front of the company's gate which led the management to believe that the youths might try to break into the premises. The management called the GF/NPF to the scene. Shortly after, GF/NPF deployed to the area and fired shots into the air, causing the protesters to disperse. At least three civilians sustained injuries as a result of the stray bullets.
GF/NA fired two heavy artillery projectiles towards the Mairamri axis upon sighting a suspected OAG gathering.
Six male criminals armed with machetes and knives attempted to rob a private residence. Nearby vigilantes and GF/NPF deployed and arrested them.
Criminals burgled a private residence, rustled rams and other valuables.
A male criminal attempted to burgle a residence, prompting the occupants to raise the alarm. Nearby civilians mobilised, apprehended the criminal and handed him over to GF/NPF.

Criminals armed with handguns kidnapped a male civilian from his private residence and demanded a ransom from his family members. The criminals released the abductee on 18.07.2021 upon receiving a ransom.
Criminals sneaked into a backyard of a private residence and rustled livestock.
A male civilian stepped on an unidentified explosive device while walking along the road near a GF/NA checkpoint. The explosion killed him.
GF/NA recovered an OAG road-planted IED and safely disposed of it via controlled detonation.
GF/NA recovered an OAG road-planted IED and safely disposed of it via controlled detonation.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped commercial vehicles in transit and asked for the passengers’ identifications before allowing them to continue their journey. No abductions or robberies were reported.
GF/NA together with GF/CJTF arrested at least seven suspected OAG accomplices during an operation and seized a large quantity of fish from them.

OAG/ISWAP operatives with rifles ambushed a GF/NA-escorted civilian convoy in transit along the road, prompting GF to return fire. The exchange lasted for several minutes until the operatives retreated. During the armed clash, the operatives shot and killed one GF/NA member and injured three others. ISWAP claimed the attack via Amaq on 18.07.2021.

OAG/ISWAP operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped several commercial vehicles in transit and asked for the passengers’ identifications. They identified at least two male civilians and abducted them. The operatives fired shots at two vehicles that refused to stop. The bullets injured one of the drivers but the vehicles passed through the VCP. GF/NA deployed to the scene and engaged the operatives, prompting them to retreat. ISWAP claimed the clash with GF/NA at the scene of VCP via Amaq on 18.07.2021.
A male OAG operative approached a GF/CJTF position at the outskirts of the town and surrendered.
Criminals burgled a residence and stole foodstuff while the occupants were asleep.

Criminals armed with handguns kidnapped a male civilian from his private residence and demanded a ransom from his family members. The criminals released the abductee on 18.07.2021 upon receiving a ransom.
Four male criminals armed with machetes and knives broke into a private residence and robbed the occupants of valuables. They also injured one male civilian after he resisted.

Criminals armed with handguns kidnapped a male civilian in his private residence and demanded a ransom from his family members. The criminals released the abductee later that same day at 1900hrs upon receiving the ransom.
GF/NA recovered an OAG road-planted IED and safely disposed of it via controlled detonation.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped commercial vehicles in transit and asked for the passengers’ identifications before allowing them to continue their journey. No abductions or robberies were reported.
OAG operatives with rifles abducted a male farmer, whom they suspected to be a vigilante member, from a farm on the outskirts of the town.
OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. Shortly after, GF/NA deployed to the scene, prompting the operatives to retreat. No contacts were reported.
A male criminal stole a ram from a market and attempted to sell it. The owner recovered the ram, apprehended the criminal and handed him over to GF/NPF.
A male OAG operative approached a GF/CJTF position on the outskirts of the town and surrendered.
OAG/ISWAP operatives with rifles attacked a vigilante-manned position and killed two vigilante members. ISWAP claimed the attack via Amaq on 18.07.2021.
GF/NA stationed in Konduga town fired two heavy artillery projectiles and machine guns towards Lawanti axis upon sighting a suspected OAG gathering.
Criminals released a male civilian upon receiving a ransom. The criminals had kidnapped him on 17.07.2021 at about 0200hrs in Dede.
Two male criminals armed with knives, pretending to be regular passengers stabbed and injured a motorcycle rider and robbed him of his motorcycle while in transit along a street.

OAG/ISWAP operatives with rifles attacked a small GF/NA post on the outskirts of the town, prompting GF to return fire. The exchange lasted for several minutes until a GF/NA reinforcement team deployed, causing the operatives to retreat. During the armed clash, the operatives shot and killed three GF/NA members. ISWAP claimed the attack via Amaq on 19.07.2021.
Criminals pretending to be regular passengers waved a motorcycle rider in transit along a street, prompting him to stop. Subsequently, they robbed him of his motorcycle.

Suspected OAG/ISWAP operatives abducted a male civilian in a market. The operatives then moved the civilian to their camp and informed him that another civilian, a native from Sabon Gari, had raised allegations against him over a suspected fraud case. Allegedly, the abductee had received an amount of money from the complainant in exchange for certain goods during a regular commercial operation that had taken place in Biu market a few months back. After receiving the money, the abductee had failed to deliver the agreed goods and subsequently stopped answering calls from the complainant. 
Upon interrogation, the abductee admitted that the allegations against him were true. The operatives then instructed him to return the money he had received during the commercial agreement, which he immediately did. The abductee remained under custody until 19.07.2021. Before releasing the victim, the operatives flogged him 50 times.
Criminals armed with handguns kidnapped a male civilian from his private residence and demanded a ransom from his family members.

OAG operatives with rifles attacked a GF/NA post on the outskirts of the town, prompting GF to return fire. The exchange lasted for several minutes until the operatives retreated. No casualties were reported.
Criminals sneaked into a backyard of a private residence and rustled a cow.
Civilians recovered a dead body of a male civilian pierced with an arrow from a swamp. The motives of the killing remained unknown.
GF/NA recovered an OAG road-planted IED and safely disposed of it via controlled detonation.
Two male OAG operatives approached a GF/NA position on the outskirts of the town and surrendered.
GF/NA together with GF/CJTF arrested seven male suspected OAG accomplices, seized foodstuff and other valuables from them.

A male criminal stole a ram while it was grazing along a street. While he was leaving, the owner sighted him and raised the alarm. Nearby civilians trailed, apprehend the criminal, recovered the ram and handed the perpetrator over to GF/NPF.
GF/NA restricted vehicular movements along the road. The restriction was linked to GF operations in the general area.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped commercial vehicles in transit and asked for the passengers’ identifications before allowing them to continue their journey. No abductions or robberies were reported.

OAG operatives with rifles arrived at the outskirts of the town on foot and attacked a GF/NA checkpoint, prompting GF to return fire. The exchange lasted for several minutes until the operatives retreated. No casualties were reported.

OAG operatives with rifles aboard several vehicles infiltrated the location and summoned the elders of the village for a meeting. The operatives gave a warning to the elders stating that if the youth of the village would engage with vigilantes or CJTF, the operatives would attack the location and displace everyone. They subsequently left without harming anyone.

Criminals armed with sticks robbed a male civilian walking along a street from money and a mobile phone and then killed the victim by beating him to death. The motives triggering the killing remained unknown.

Criminals armed with handguns broke into a private residence and robbed the occupants of money. They also shot and injured two male civilians who resisted.
GF/NPF announced vehicular movement restrictions within the town between 0600hrs and 1200hrs. The restriction was linked to the planned Eid al Adha prayers on 20.07.2021.

OAG operatives released a male civilian they had abducted at a market in Nguma on 17.07.2021 upon the allegations of fraud by another civilian. When the abductee had admitted that the accusations against him were true and returned the money, the operatives flogged him 50 times and subsequently released.
Criminals armed with handguns kidnapped a male civilian from his private residence and demanded a ransom from his family members.

OAG operatives with rifles attacked a GF/NA position prompting GF/NA to return fire. The exchange lasted for several minutes until the operatives retreated. During the armed clash, GF/NA shot and killed one operative and seized his rifle.
OAG operatives with rifles attacked a GF/NA position, prompting GF to return fire. The exchange lasted for several minutes until the operatives retreated. No casualties were reported.

OAG/ISWAP operatives with rifles aboard six light trucks mounted with HMGs and four motorcycles attacked a GF/NA position prompting GF/NA to return fire. The exchange lasted for several minutes until a GF/NA reinforcement team from Konduga town deployed prompting the operatives to retreat. During the armed clash, the operatives shot and killed four GF/NA members, injured three others, and seized one GF/NA vehicle and weaponry. ISWAP claimed the attack via Amaq the same day.
GF/NA fired at least 11 heavy artillery projectiles towards Ngauramari axis upon sighting suspected OAG operatives crossing the road aboard several vehicles.

A criminal armed with a machete injured a GF/NPF member while the latter was attempting to arrest him and fled the scene.

Two groups of ‘Kalare’ gang members armed with machetes and sticks clashed with each other. During the clash, one group injured at least seven males from the other group and destroyed two of their vehicles parked along the street.

GF/NA fired machine guns towards Wuturo axis upon sighting a suspected OAG gathering.

Five ‘Kalare’ gang members with machetes and knives attacked and injured two male civilians over a political dispute.

GF/NA fired machine guns and two heavy artillery projectiles towards the outskirts of the town upon sighting suspected OAG movements aboard light trucks mounted with HMGs. An unidentified projectile fired by an unknown actor landed in Kusurmari area and damaged a private residence.
GF/NA fired two heavy artillery projectiles towards Bashiri village upon sighting suspected OAG movements.

OAG operatives with rifles attacked a GF/NA position on the Gulumba Gana axis, prompting GF to return fire. The exchange lasted for several minutes until the operatives retreated. During the armed clash, the operatives shot and killed one GF/NA member and seized his rifle.

The local government authorities summoned community leaders and community members. The authorities pleaded with the community members to return items they had looted from an IO compound during a violent protest that occurred on 15.07.2021. Shortly after, several community members returned some of the items, such as: solar panels, vehicle spare parts, office stationery and other valuables.

OAG/ISWAP operatives with rifles attacked a GF/NA position on the Gulumba Gana axis, prompting GF to return fire. The exchange lasted for several minutes until the operatives retreated. GF/NPF arrested 15 male criminals suspected to be 'Kalare' gang members that had clashed with a rival 'Kalare' group on 21.07.2021 in the same area.

Four criminals armed with iron rods broke into a private residence. They robbed a male occupant of valuables and subsequently killed him. Reportedly, one of the criminals was the victim’s house help. GF/NPF arrested the criminals on 24.07.2021.
Criminals burgled a private residence, rustled cattle and stole other valuables.

Criminals armed with handguns kidnapped a male civilian from his private residence. The criminals called the victim's family members and demanded a ransom. They also warned them not to inform the police authorities.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped several commercial vehicles in transit and asked for the passengers' identifications before allowing them to continue their journey. No abductions or robberies were reported.

Criminals armed with machetes, knives and iron rods broke into four private residences and robbed the occupants of money and other valuables. No casualties were reported.
GF/NPF acted on a tip-off and arrested three male criminals suspected to have participated in a burglary.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped several commercial vehicles in transit and asked for the passengers' identifications before allowing them to continue their journey. No abductions or robberies were reported.

GF/NPF arrested four criminals that had robbed and killed a male civilian at Red Bricks Housing Estate in Damaturu on 22.07.2021. Reportedly, they arrested one of the criminals while he was carting away valuable items from the victim’s house. During the interrogation the criminal gave up the identities of his three accomplices.  Subsequently GF/NPF arrested them too.
A male OAG operative with his wife approached a GF/NA position and surrendered.

GF/NA arrested seven male farmers suspected of having links with OAG operatives.

OAG/ISWAP operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped and carjacked a commercial vehicle and a borehole rig in transit. The operatives also abducted at least four passengers from both vehicles including one off-duty GF/NA member and three government officials upon discovering Army and Government IDs in their possession. GF/Rapid Response Squad (RRS) deployed to the scene and exchanged fire with the operatives, prompting them to retreat with the vehicles and abductees. ISWAP claimed the VCP and the abductions via Amaq on 25.07.2021.
Criminals released a male civilian upon receiving a ransom. The criminals had abducted the victim from his private residence in Wurogude on 22.07.2021.

Criminals stole valuables from a vehicle which had broken down and the owner abandoned it on the street.
Following a tip-off, vigilantes apprehended a male criminal at the market who had stolen a bag of maize from a store on 24.07.2021. They didn't recover the maize.
Four male OAG operatives along with their five family members -three females and two children- approached a GF/NA checkpoint and surrendered.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped several commercial vehicles in transit and asked for the passenger's identifications before allowing them to continue their journey. No abductions or robberies were reported.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped a commercial vehicle in transit and asked for the passengers’ identifications. They identified an off-duty GF/NA member, three other male civilians and subsequently abducted them.
Five suspected OAG family members -two women and three girls- approached a GF/CJTF position on the outskirts of the town and surrendered.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped several commercial vehicles in transit. The operatives carjacked one commercial vehicle loaded with foodstuff and valuables and temporarily detained the driver. They drove the vehicle to the nearby bush, offloaded the items, siphoned the fuel from it and subsequently released the driver and the vehicle.

GF/NA arrested a male criminal passing himself as a GF/NPF member while in transit aboard a commercial vehicle. GF/NA recovered 220 rounds of ammunition, one hand grenade and a knife from him at a GF/NA vehicle checkpoint.

An unspecified number of criminals arrived aboard a motorised tricycle, snatched a bag with valuables from a female civilian and then pushed her away inflicting minor injuries. The incident happened while the victim was waiting to board a commercial tricycle by the roadside after stepping out of the supermarket's perimeter area.
‘Shilla’ gang members armed with knives pretending to be regular passengers of a motorised tricycle injured and robbed another male passenger of money and valuables.

GF/NA fired machine guns towards Goniri Kadauye upon sighting suspected OAG operatives, prompting them to return fire. The exchange lasted for several minutes until the operatives retreated. The outcome was unknown.

Criminals arrived aboard a motorised tricycle and snatched groceries from a male civilian. The incident happened while the victim was standing by the roadside waiting to board a commercial tricycle  after stepping out of the supermarket's perimeter area.

GF/CJTF members together with local security guards acted on a tip-off and apprehended three male individuals at the parking lot outside the supermarket's perimeter. The males are suspected to have robbed a female civilian at 1900hrs and a male civilian at 2000hrs at the same location.
Criminals armed with handguns abducted a male civilian from his private residence. They also shot and injured another male civilian that resisted.

‘Shilla’ gang members armed with knives pretending to be regular passengers of a motorised tricycle robbed two other passengers -a male and a female- of money and valuables. They also injured the male passenger for resisting.

Individuals of Waja ethnicity armed with machetes attacked and injured five individuals of Lunguda ethnicity and set on fire several of their houses. Shortly after, the members of Lugunda ethnic group mobilised, prompting the Wajas to retreat.
Criminals entered a parking lot and stole a car battery from a vehicle.
Criminals armed with handguns attempted to break into a private residence. Nearby vigilantes deployed and exchanged fire with them until the criminals retreated. No casualties were reported.
Criminals rustled cattle from a private residence. Following a tip-off, GF/NPF arrested the criminals in Babbangida on 28.07.2021.
Three male OAG operatives and one female OAG family member approached a GF/CJTF position and surrendered. The operatives also handed over one rifle to the GF/CJTF.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped commercial vehicles in transit and asked for the passengers’ identifications before allowing them to continue their journey. No abductions or robberies were reported.

OAG operatives with rifles on foot entered a farmland and confiscated a tractor from a male farmer. Subsequently, the operatives demanded a sum of 100,000 Naira as a payment to secure the return of the tractor.

The operatives also threatened to punish civilians that disobeyed the order and left the area without giving any explanations for imposing this rule.
GF/NA fired machine guns towards Yaleri Kurna axis upon sighting suspected OAG movements. The operatives fired back and subsequently retreated. No casualties were reported.

Gombe state government imposed an indefinite 24-hour curfew in this location, Nyuwar, Jessu, Heme, Yolde, Gelentuku, Sikam and Wala-Lunguda towns. The curfew was linked to the ethno-political clashes between Lunguda and Waja ethnic groups that occurred on 26.07.2021.

OAG operatives with rifles on motorcycles abducted two male farmers while others managed to escape. The operatives released both farmers unharmed on 28.07.2021 after scrutinising them.

OAG operatives with rifles attacked a GF/NA position prompting GF/NA to return fire. The exchange lasted for several minutes until the operatives retreated. No casualties were reported.
Farmers of Waja ethnicity armed with machetes and blunt objects encroached on farmlands belonging to the farmers of Lugunda ethnic group and destroyed the crops. No casualties were reported.
Criminals armed with knives broke into a private residence. They robbed a male occupant of his motorcycle and injured him for resisting.

16 suspected  OAG family members  -three aged men, three children and ten women- approached a GF/NA position and surrendered.
OAG operatives with rifles arrived to the outskirts of the area on motorcycles and released two male farmers they had abducted in Dalwa on 27.07.21 after scrutinising them.

GF/NA together GF/CJTF, acting on a tip-off, conducted an operation against a suspected OAG camp on the outskirts of the area. GF/NA set on fire suspected OAG’s structures and destroyed valuables. No contacts were reported.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped commercial vehicles in transit and asked for the passengers’ identifications before allowing them to continue their journey. No abductions or robberies were reported.

Hunters, acting on a tip-off, apprehended one of the criminals that had stolen 60,000 Naira from a passenger in Kabang at about 0900hrs.

Five suspected OAG family members: 3 females and 2 children, approached a GF/CJTF position and surrendered.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped commercial vehicles in transit and asked for the passengers’ identifications before allowing them to continue their journey. No abductions or robberies were reported.

GF/NA on patrol made contact with OAG operatives and exchanged fire with them until the operatives retreated. No casualties were reported.

Two groups of 'Kalare' gang members armed with knives and sticks clashed with each other over political issues during a rally. GF/NPF deployed and arrested six gang members while the others fled.

Criminals armed with handguns set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road.  They fired shots at one vehicle that turned back upon sighting the VCP. The driver managed to escape but three passengers sustained gunshots injuries.

OAG/ISWAP operatives with rifles ambushed a GF/NA convoy in transit along the road using direct fire and an IED. A GF/NA vehicle leading the convoy hit a road-planted IED and immediately after, the operatives engaged the convoy, prompting GF/NA to return fire. The operatives, reportedly, shot and killed one GF/NA member and injured two others while the explosion damaged the vehicle and injured two GF/NA members. Stray bullets also damaged a civilian vehicle in transit along the road at the time of the incident and injured at least two passengers. Concurrently, another group of OAG operatives ambushed a GF reinforcement team at Kareto while they were deploying to the scene. ISWAP claimed the attack via Amaq on 01.08.2021.
GF/NA, acting on a tip-off, arrested five male suspected OAG logistics suppliers and seized a vehicle and several jerrycans of fuel from them.

OAG/ISWAP operatives with rifles ambushed a GF/NA reinforcement team on its way to Mbanari to respond to an OAG/ISWAP ambush against a GF/NA convoy, prompting GF to return fire. During the armed clash, the operatives reportedly shot and killed three GF members and injured six others. ISWAP claimed the attack via an-Naba' on 06.08.2021.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped commercial vehicles in transit and asked for the passengers’ identifications before allowing them to continue their journey. No abductions or robberies were reported.
A male criminal beat up a female IDP following a disagreement over her children. Shortly after, GF/NPF arrested the criminal.
‘Kalare’ gang members armed with machetes attacked and injured six male civilians that were sitting along a street. No robberies were reported.
GF/NA fired machine guns towards the outskirts of the town upon sighting suspected OAG movements.
Criminals armed with knives and machetes injured and robbed three male civilians of their mobile phones.
A 23-year-old man raped a three-year-old girl. Nearby civilians apprehended him, beat him up, and handed him over to GF/NPF.

A male criminal entered three private residences and stole four mobile phones. While leaving the last house at about 0200hrs, vigilantes on patrol apprehended him, recovered the stolen items, and handed him over to GF/NPF.
A male OAG operative approached a GF/CJTF position on the outskirts of the town and surrendered.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped commercial vehicles in transit and asked for the passengers’ identifications before allowing them to continue their journey. No abductions or robberies were reported.
13 OAG operatives with 13 rifles approached a GF/NA position and surrendered. Reportedly, they had earlier sent farmers to inform GF about the time of their planned surrender.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped several commercial vehicles in transit, searched for passengers’ identification, identified three male civilians from different vehicles, and abducted them. They also carjacked a bus and abducted at least ten passengers aboard it. GF/NA deployed to the scene and exchanged fire with them, prompting the operatives to retreat.

Suspected OAG/ISWAP operatives aboard a vehicle and two motorcycles entered the town and abducted two staff members under the Biu LGA Primary Health Care (PHC) department that are working as volunteers for an IO while they were conducting activities linked to a cholera immunisation campaign. After apprehending them, the operatives accused the victims of spying for the government and left the location along with the abductees, without harming anyone. They also seized drugs and a vehicle belonging to the LGA PHC Department from them. The operatives released the abductees at 1800hrs the same day, following a pledge from local residents in favor of their release.

A female criminal entered a private residence and stole a mobile phone. The owner of the phone searched the belongings of other civilians and found the Sim card in a bag belonging to a female individual suspected to be the criminal. The owner subsequently handed the suspect over to GF/NPF.

OAG operatives with rifles aboard light trucks mounted with HMGs attacked a GF/NA position at the entrance of the town, towards the northern axis, prompting GF to return fire and eventually GF retreated from the position. The operatives then proceeded to the town and fired shots into the air before withdrawing. At least one- girl child sustained injuries as a result of the crossfire.
Unidentified individuals stole an AK 47 rifle from a GF/NPF member while he was in the toilet at his duty station.
Criminals stopped a private vehicle in transit along the road. They kidnapped the driver and demanded a ransom. The abductee is a staff of Yobe state hospital management board.

Criminals on motorcycles abducted a female civilian while she was washing her clothes by a stream. On 01.08.2021 the criminals contacted the family of the victim and demanded a ransom of 1.000.000 Naira.
A male criminal stole a motorcycle parked in front of a zoo.

OAG operatives released two staff of Biu LGA Primary Health Care (PHC) department working as volunteer for an IO whom they had earlier abducted in Mandaragirau. Following the abduction,  local residents went to an ISWAP camp in the area and informed the operatives that the abductees were in their village to assist them in curbing a cholera outbreak and not for spying. Reportedly, one of the civilians begged for the release of the victims arguing that one of his children desperately needed medical attention. Thereafter, the operatives eventually agreed to release the abductees and brought them back to Mandaragirau.
A male criminal rustled a ram from a residence. On 02.08.2021 vigilantes on patrol apprehended the criminal at Fulatari, recovered the ram and handed him over to GF/NPF.
OAG operatives with rifles abducted three male teenagers (approx 14 - 15year old).
Vigilantes on patrol apprehended a male criminal who had rustled a ram from a residence in the area on 01.08.2021. They recovered the stolen ram and handed the criminal over to GF/NPF.
57 OAG family members comprising of women, elderly men and children approached a GF/NA position and surrendered.
OAG operatives with rifles and knives killed three male fishermen by slitting their throats for violating the OAG order not to fish in certain areas of the river.
41 suspected OAG family members comprising of women and children approached a GF/NA position and surrendered.
Two male OAG operatives approached a GF/NA position and surrendered.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped commercial vehicles in transit and asked for the passengers’ identifications before allowing them to continue their journey. No abductions or robberies were reported.
Four male OAG operatives together with 11 of their family members: five females and six children, approached a GF/NA position and surrendered.

OAG/ISWAP operatives with rifles aboard light trucks mounted with HMGs attacked a GF/NA position at the entrance of the town, prompting GF to return fire. The exchange lasted for several minutes until GF deployed CAS, causing the operatives to retreat. Shortly after, GF/NA mobilized and trailed the operatives until they made contact with them in the vicinity of Kareram Mullumti. ISWAP claimed the attack via Amaq on 04.08.2021.
50 OAG operatives with 37 rifles and six RPGs approached a GF/NA position and surrendered.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped several commercial vehicles in transit, eye checked the drivers and passengers and subsequently allowed them to continue their journey. No abductions or robberies were reported.
GF/NA fired two heavy artillery projectiles towards Lawanti axis upon sighting suspected OAG gathering.

GF/NA trailed OAG/ISWAP operatives that had attacked a GF position in Gubio a few hours earlier and made contact with them, prompting the operatives to return fire. The exchange lasted for several minutes until the operatives retreated. During the armed clash, GF shot and killed at least five operatives and arrested another. Additionally, a GF CAS deployed and carried out an airstrike. The strike killed one operative and destroyed one OAG vehicle. GF also seized one OAG vehicle, weapons, and fuel from the operatives. While the OAG operatives reportedly shot and killed two GF members.
GF/NA fired three heavy artillery projectiles towards the Sambisa Forest upon sighting suspected OAG movement between 1600hrs and 2100hrs.
Two male civilians armed with knives fought and injured each other following a dispute between their respective wives.
Three male criminals armed with knives robbed two female civilians of mobile phone, money, and valuables.

Criminals armed with sticks mounted an informal vehicle checkpoint along a secondary road and stopped two commercial tricycles in transit. They robbed the riders of their tricycles, mobile phones and money.
GF/NA on patrol entered the town and ordered residents to stop patronising the local market
Criminals burgled a shop and stole foodstuff and other valuables.
Criminals burgled a private residence and rustled five cows, stole cow feed and other valuables while the occupants were asleep.
OAG operatives with rifles attacked a GF/NA position, prompting GF to return fire. The exchange lasted for several minutes until the operatives retreated. No casualties were reported.
100 OAG family members comprising of women, elderly men and children approached a GF/NA position and surrendered.
GF/NA on patrol recovered an OAG road-planted IED and safely disposed of it via controlled detonation.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road and stopped several commercial vehicles in transit. They asked for the passenger's identification and searched the passenger's belongings before subsequently allowing them to continue their journey. No abductions or robberies were reported.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped commercial vehicles in transit and asked for the passengers’ identifications before allowing them to continue their journey. No abductions or robberies were reported.

A male criminal entered a construction site and stole construction materials. Shortly after, vigilantes on patrol apprehended him at the Low-Cost Housing Estate area, recovered the stolen items and handed him over to GF/NPF.
OAG operatives with rifles robbed fishermen of two canoes and three mobile phones.
A female OAG family member and her child approached a GF/CJTF position on the outskirt of the town and surrendered.
Criminals burgled into a private residence and stole two mobile phones.
Two criminals armed with knives aboard a motorcycle injured and robbed a male civilian of his laptop bag while standing by the roadside.
A criminal stole a bicycle parked in front of a residence.

GF/NA entered the market in the afternoon and fired shots into the air, causing panic among civilians. As a result of the stampede, at least 10 civilians sustained injuries. This incident followed a GF order urging civilians to stop patronizing this market instead of Cross Kauwa's market.
Criminals burgled a grocery shop and stole foodstuff and other valuables.
Criminals rustled five sheep from the backyard of a private residence.
Two female OAG family members approached a GF/NA position and surrendered.
OAG operatives accidentally detonated at least two OAG road-planted IEDs, while deploying the IEDs along the road. The explosion killed six OAG operatives.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped commercial vehicles in transit and asked for the passengers’ identifications before allowing them to continue their journey. No abductions or robberies were reported.
Four male OAG operatives with four rifles approached a GF/NA position and surrendered.
GF/NA recovered an OAG road planted IED and safely disposed of it via controlled detonation. Prior to the recovery, civilians on transit to Uba town market spotted the device and reported to GF.
One OAG operative with his rifle approached a GF/NA position and surrendered.
Six male OAG operatives and two female family members approached a GF/NA position and surrendered. They also handed over five rifles and one HMG to GF.
GF/NA restricted vehicular movements along the road until 1200hrs. The reason for the restriction was unknown.
10 male OAG operatives approached a GF/NA position and surrendered
A male criminal armed with a knife injured a male civilian following a disagreement. Shortly after, GF/NPF arrested the criminal.
OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They carjacked a truck carrying foodstuff and abducted the driver.
Herdsmen armed with machetes and sticks encroached on a farm and destroyed crops, prompting the farmer to confront them. The herders injured the farmer.

OAG operatives with rifles aboard a vehicle and on motorcycles attacked a small GF/NA post, prompting GF to return fire. The exchange lasted for several minutes until the operatives retreated. No casualties were reported.
Three male criminals armed with knives robbed two female civilians of phones and other valuables while they were standing by the roadside.

‘Shilla’ gang members armed with knives and machetes mounted an informal vehicle checkpoint along a secondary road and stopped a commercial tricycle in transit. They robbed a passenger of his mobile phone and bag before leaving the area.
Suspected OAG operatives stole beverages, fuel and building materials from three trucks that had broke down due to mechanical fault and abandoned along the road by the drivers
Criminals burgled a store at night and stole foodstuff.

GF/NA entered the market in the afternoon and fired shots into the air, causing panic among civilians. As a result of the stampede, at least 15 civilians sustained injuries. This incident followed a GF order urging civilians to stop patronizing this market instead of Cross Kauwa's market.

OAG operatives with rifles attacked a small GF/NA post at the location, prompting GF to return fire. The exchange lasted for several minutes until the operatives retreated. During the armed clash, GF shot and killed one operative and arrested another. Following a tip-off from the operative that had been arrested, GF/NA  arrested two OAG accomplices at line 5 and line 9 in the location.
A male criminal attempted to rape an eight-year-old girl in a private residence. Nearby civilians apprehended him and handed him over to GF/NPF.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped several commercial vehicles in transit and searched for passengers’ identification. They identified two individuals suspected to be off-duty GF/NA members and subsequently, shot and killed them. They also abducted another male civilian before withdrawing.
Three male OAG operatives with rifles and HMGs approached a GF/NA position and surrendered.

OAG operatives with rifles set up an informal vehicle checkpoint along the road. They stopped commercial vehicles in transit and asked for the passengers’ identifications before allowing them to continue their journey. No abductions or robberies were reported.

GF/CJTF members armed with handguns shot and killed a male civilian and injured five others when a mob began pelting stones at the staff of Borno Geographical Information System (BOGIS). The mob attempted to stop a crane belonging to the BOGIS while they were demolishing some structures including a church. GF/NPF disarmed the CJTF members and detained two of them for further investigation.

GF/NA members entered a local market and beat up several civilians for disobeying GF’s order to stop patronizing the market, causing panic among the other civilians. As a result of the stampede, at least 15 civilians sustained injuries. This incident followed a GF order urging civilians to stop patronizing this market instead of Cross Kauwa's market.
Nine suspected OAG family members comprising of five women, two boys and two girls approached a GF/NA position and surrendered.
OAG operatives with rifles infiltrated the town, shot and killed three male civilians and abducted another for unknown reason.
A male criminal snatched money from a female IDP member and ran away. GF/CJTF apprehended him and recovered the stolen money as well as three other INGO beneficiary cards that he had stolen.
Criminals burgled a mosque and stole a power generator.
Criminals released a female civilian after receiving a ransom. The criminals had kidnapped her on 03.08.2021 at Kwaja.
